title: Women journalists barred: Taliban restricts females at presser in Delhi; draws ire
content: Afghan foreign minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's press conference in Delhi saw no women journalists present, mirroring Taliban's gender curbs. Despite India's suggestion for inclusion, the decision was reportedly made by Taliban officials. Muttaqi deflected questions on women's rights, citing national customs and claiming improved peace and stability since their 2021 takeover.

title: India elevates its ties with Taliban, to reopen embassy
content: India is upgrading its technical mission in Kabul to an embassy. This significant step follows a visit by Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi. India announced new projects and humanitarian aid for Afghanistan. Both sides condemned cross-border terrorism. India reaffirmed its commitment to Afghanistan's sovereignty. The visit aims to boost diplomatic and economic ties.

title: Eight Indians, 10 firms face US sanctions over Iran oil link
content: America has sanctioned eight Indian individuals and ten companies. These actions are due to their involvement in trading Iranian oil. The US state department and treasury targeted numerous entities globally. Several Indian firms are accused of importing Iranian-origin petrochemicals and LPG. These shipments were destined for China and Pakistan. The sanctions highlight ongoing efforts to curb Iran's oil trade.

title: Microsoft engineer quits: emails thousands of staff; says can't enable war
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal plays doctor for Shubman Gill after on-field collision - Watch
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's unbeaten 173 powered India to a dominant 318/2 against West Indies on Day 1. A lighthearted moment saw Jaiswal humorously check captain Shubman Gill for concussion after a collision. Jaiswal's exceptional knock, his second 150+ on Day 1 in India, puts him in elite company, setting the stage for a potential series sweep.

title: ‘Don’t give your wealth to Bill Gates’: Thiel warned Musk on pledge; slammed ‘leftist’ nonprofits
content: Peter Thiel revealed he advised Elon Musk to reconsider the Giving Pledge, warning his fortune could end up with "left-leaning nonprofits" chosen by Bill Gates. Thiel expressed concern about global power structures and an "Antichrist" figure gaining control.

title: Jaz Elle’s one-word reaction to Andre Agassi’s iconic tennis fashion
content: Tennis icon Andre Agassi, fresh off leading Team World to victory at the 2025 Laver Cup, delighted fans with a throwback post of his iconic 80s and 90s fashion. His daughter, Jaz Elle Agassi, praised his "Majestic" style. Agassi also shared his competitive spirit as captain, calling the win a "special week."

title: 'Gaza will be rebuilt': Trump on ceasefire; will set up a 'board of peace'
content: US President Donald Trump expressed optimism for the Israel-Hamas ceasefire, anticipating Gaza's rebuilding with Arab funding and the establishment of a "Board of Peace." He highlighted the significant retribution against Hamas and the widespread desire for peace across the Middle East, calling the deal beneficial for all.

title: SC questions HC order for SIT probe into Karur stampede
content: The Supreme Court questioned the Madras High Court's principal bench for ordering an SIT probe into the Karur stampede, bypassing the Madurai bench's jurisdiction and the original petition's focus on rally protocols. Justices Maheshwari and Anjaria also queried Tamil Nadu on permitting the rally despite denying others and the unusual midnight postmortems. TVK sought a retired SC judge's supervision for the probe, citing concerns over state officials' impartiality.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
content: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: 'Opportunity to get a 300': Kumble hails Jaiswal's hunger for big scores
content: Legendary spinner Anil Kumble lauded young opener Yashasvi Jaiswal's unbeaten 173 on day one of the second Test against West Indies. Kumble believes Jaiswal's hunger and ability to convert starts into big scores present a golden opportunity for him to achieve a historic triple century on Saturday, joining elite Indian batters.

title: 'Usko lagna nahi chahiye!' - Nayar turns bodyguard for Rohit Sharma
content: Former India cricketer Abhishek Nayar shielded Rohit Sharma from an overwhelming crowd outside Mumbai's Shivaji Park, pleading for the star to avoid injury. The viral clip highlights the intense fan passion surrounding Rohit, even after his ODI captaincy change, as he trains for the upcoming Australia tour.

title: DCC’s Kelli Finglass returns with empowering message in Mississippi
content: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders director Kelli Finglass headlined Forrest Health's Spirit of Women luncheon in Hattiesburg, sharing a message of empowerment and resilience. The event, themed "The Grit Behind the Glam," celebrated women's strength and perseverance.  Finglass's keynote speech, reflecting on her leadership journey, deeply resonated with attendees, marking a significant comeback for the annual gathering.

title: Ayesha Curry sparks outrage with family photos after remarks
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, has ignited fan fury with a recent Instagram post after previously admitting she didn't want marriage or children. Her "Life lately" caption, featuring family photos, drew sharp criticism, with followers questioning her sincerity and urging Stephen to reconsider their union. The couple has remained silent amidst the backlash.

title: Kayla Nicole backs diss tracks amid Taylor Swift ‘Opalite’ drama
content: Taylor Swift's new album has fans buzzing, with one song sparking speculation about Travis Kelce's ex, Kayla Nicole. Instead of engaging in online drama, Nicole used her podcast to advocate for artists settling disputes through music, citing Cardi B and Nicki Minaj. She also subtly responded on social media, demonstrating a calm approach to celebrity gossip.

title: Repatriate pregnant woman: Bangladesh court to Indian mission
content: A pregnant woman, wrongly deported to Bangladesh as an "illegal immigrant," is set to return to India following a judicial order. Sunali Khatun and five others, identified by Aadhaar cards, were pushed across the border by Delhi Police. A Bangladeshi court has directed the Indian High Commission to facilitate their safe repatriation, highlighting concerns over the police's hasty actions and the plight of the detained individuals.

title: Explosion at US military explosives plant: 19 people missing and feared dead
content: A powerful explosion rocked a military explosives manufacturing facility in rural Tennessee on Friday morning, causing homes to shake and prompting an emergency response. Officials urged the public to stay clear as ongoing blasts prevented access to the site, with no immediate confirmation of casualties. Footage showed burning debris and smoke rising from the facility near Bucksnort.

title: Ahead of taking charge, US envoy Sergio Gor in India to meet officials on bilateral ties
content: US ambassador-designate to India, Sergio Gor, is visiting India for pre-assumption charge discussions on bilateral issues and strengthening the strategic partnership. The US embassy also clarified that recent foreign military sales amendments do not include new missile deliveries or upgrades for Pakistan. This visit precedes potential meetings between Prime Minister Modi and US President Trump.

title: Centre in Supreme Court: In talks with J&K government on statehood restoration
content: The Centre informed the Supreme Court it's consulting Jammu and Kashmir's elected government on restoring statehood, excluding Ladakh's Union Territory status. Solicitor general Tushar Mehta stated the government will respond to pleas for statehood restoration within four weeks, citing security concerns like cross-border terrorism. Pleas highlight the breach of an earlier undertaking to restore statehood post-elections.

title: We're sure Tamil Nadu, Madhya Pradesh taking action: Centre on cough syrup deaths
content: The Supreme Court expressed concern over child deaths in Madhya Pradesh due to contaminated cough syrup but refused to monitor a probe. Solicitor general Tushar Mehta intervened, stating states are addressing the issue, and the court should trust them to act. The PIL was dismissed as the petitioner has a history of filing similar petitions.

title: On Diwali, ‘green crackers’ set to return with a bang
content: The Supreme Court is poised to permit the sale and use of green firecrackers in Delhi and NCR for Diwali, Gurupurav, and Christmas. While reserving orders, the bench questioned the necessity of a complete ban, noting no significant increase in pollution attributed to crackers. The government proposed strict measures, including a ban on series crackers and online sales, to ensure only approved green crackers are available.

title: Ground Boeing 787s, demands pilots’ body
content: An Air India Boeing 787 diverted to Dubai due to a technical snag, with its autopilot system failing. This follows another incident last week where a Dreamliner's ram air turbine deployed on approach. The Federation of Indian Pilots has urged the grounding of all B787s amid continuous electrical issues and called for a special audit of Air India's aircraft maintenance.

title: Influx from Pakistan, Bangladesh fuelling disparity in population growth: Amit Shah
content: Home minister Amit Shah said that infiltration, not fertility, drives demographic shifts, posing a threat to India's culture and democratic ethos. He vowed a "detect, delete and deport" strategy against infiltrators, linking their inclusion in voter lists to constitutional corruption. Shah also defended the CAA as a national pledge fulfilled.

title: Man beaten to death, Army jawan critical after clash in dhaba over ‘food served cold’
content: Tragedy struck in Bijnor's Haldaur area where a 22-year-old man was beaten to death and his Army jawan cousin critically injured after a dispute over cold food at a dhaba. Police have suspended three officers for dereliction of duty following the incident. Two main accused have been arrested, with a murder case registered against five individuals. Angry villagers protested, demanding swift justice.

title: First-term NDA cadet found dead in his cabin; Pune police suspect suicide
content: A first-term National Defence Academy cadet, Antriksh Kumar Singh, was found dead in his cabin, with police suspecting suicide. The 18-year-old from Lucknow had reportedly expressed stress over issues with senior cadets. A Court of Inquiry has been ordered to investigate the circumstances surrounding his death.

title: Centre denies nod for Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan’s Gulf tour
content: The Union government has reportedly denied permission for Kerala chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan's 15-day Gulf tour, scheduled to begin on October 16. The ministry of external affairs rejected the clearance without specifying reasons. The trip was intended as an outreach program by Malayalam Mission but held political significance ahead of state assembly elections.

title: Himachal BJP chief's brother held in rape case, party calls it 'political' plot
content: Himachal Pradesh BJP chief's elder brother, Ram Kumar Bindal, was arrested for allegedly raping a 25-year-old woman during a medical examination. The survivor claims she was assaulted under the guise of Ayurvedic treatment. The BJP has called the accusation a politically motivated act, while police are investigating.

title: Supreme Court seeks government, EC response on allowing undertrials to vote
content: A Public Interest Litigation in the Supreme Court questions why undertrial prisoners, presumed innocent, are denied voting rights under Section 62(5) of the Representation of People Act. The petition highlights that an estimated five lakh undertrials are disenfranchised, a situation contrasting with practices in other nations. The court has sought responses from the Centre and the Election Commission, though a similar plea was dismissed previously.

title: ED arrests 4 involved in Rs 100cr racket linked to digital arrests
content: The ED has arrested four individuals in Ahmedabad in a Rs 100-crore extortion case involving digital arrests and illegal forex trading. Accused allegedly laundered over Rs 100 crore through bank accounts and converted proceeds into cryptocurrency. This is part of a larger crackdown on cybercrimes where the ED has attached over Rs 8,500 crore in assets.

title: NMC data shows India added just 21 docs in a year when 80k graduated
content: India's doctor count appears stagnant, with the National Medical Commission (NMC) data showing minimal growth despite thousands graduating annually. Significant discrepancies exist between NMC figures and state medical council registrations, raising concerns about accurate healthcare planning and potentially misleading Parliament.

title: Zubeen Garg’s two PSOs arrested, sent to 5-day SIT custody
content: Assam Police's SIT arrested two personal security officers of singer Zubeen Garg in connection with his death investigation. The arrests followed the discovery of a Rs 1 crore financial transaction in the PSOs' bank accounts. This brings the total arrests in the case to seven, with the singer's wife and a political leader expressing concerns about the investigation's transparency.

title: Cam Newton: Fans say 'he can’t afford it' as QB welcomes ninth child
content: NFL star Cam Newton has welcomed his ninth child. This is his second child with girlfriend Jasmin Brown. Newton now has nine children from various relationships. Fans are reacting with excitement and questions about his finances. Newton has spoken about financial challenges post-NFL but finds purpose in fatherhood. He embraces raising his children with dedication.

title: Address issues raised by deceased IPS officer's wife: Haryana IAS Officers' Association to State govt
content: The association said the allegations need to be “thoroughly investigated in a fair, transparent, and impartial manner, which led to this unfortunate incident”

title: The gavel over Gulmarg’s hotels
content: As the government evicts the Nedous family after 137 years from the first hotel built in Gulmarg, 52 hotels on lease fear they could face the same. In 2022 the Lieutenant Governor had amended the land rules for the meadow, which are being implemented now. Peerzada Ashiq captures the mood in Kashmir’s skiing destination, as the legal battle enters the final phase

title: Manipur bans two cough syrup brands containing ‘highly toxic’ chemical
content: Drugs Control Administration issued a "public alert warning consumers, retailers, and healthcare providers against the purchase and use of two cough syrup brands found to be adulterated with a highly toxic chemical, diethylene glycol."

title: Killer cough syrup
content: Twenty-four children have died in Madhya Pradesh and three others are in a critical condition after consuming an adulterated cough syrup. Lab tests show that the syrup contained a high concentration of diethylene glycol, an industrial solvent that is never used in medicine. Bindu Shajan Perappadan and Mehul Malpani report on the horror that highlights the dangers of India’s weak regulatory system

title: RRI technique yields certified randomness with one qubit
content: Researchers built simple quantum circuits on IBM’s superconducting quantum computers, which are available on the cloud; the experiments successfully produced random numbers certified by quantum mechanics, and which classical randomness can’t fake

title: How Bengal revolutionaries often had their way in British jails
content: A new book by a Kolkata professor on British-era imprisonment in Bengal claims how incarcerated Bengali revolutionaries were different from their counterparts elsewhere in ideology and method

title: Punjab’s farmers struggle to reclaim flood-hit land amid ‘official apathy’
content: In August and September, Punjab faced one of its worst floods in decades, affecting more than 20 lakh people across 2,614 villages and displacing 6.87 lakh people

title: Odisha State Information Commission influenced by bureaucracy, red tapism, observes Orissa HC
content: Travail of petitioner who was denied information reminds of the plight of the protagonist ‘Josef’ in Kafka’s celebrated works ‘The Trial’ where he faces nightmarish bureaucracy that seems designed to confuse, remarks the HC

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari demands action against CM Mamata Banerjee for ‘threatening Chief Electoral Officer’
content: Suvendu Adhikari also demanded that by Monday, the Chief Minister must submit proof of the corruption allegations that she levelled against the CEO, and the complaints of the electoral officers who were allegedly intimidated

title: Bharatpur institution seeks PM’s intervention for development of Mewat region
content: The Samriddh Bharat Abhiyan has pointed out that unemployment is the biggest issue confronting the youth in the region

title: No animal sacrifice in Tirupparankundram for now: third judge
content: Restrictions on animal slaughter and non-vegetarian food must continue till a competent civil court decides the matter, says the High Court judge Justice Vijayakumar

title: Kozhikode Coprn. to hand over upkeep of stadium to KFA
content: The stadium had been maintained by Gokulam Kerala FC since 2023 while serving as its home ground in the I-League. However, the club recently had a fallout with the Corporation over an alleged breach of contract

title: Congress will also host a “Housing Rights Conference”: Harshwardhan Sapkal
content: Taking examples of Dharavi redevelopment project, recently inaugurated Navi Mumbai airport, Mr. Sapkal accused Mahayuti government of putting Mumbai up for sale for their favourite businessman

title: Engineering student, another man killed in alleged assault by police personnel in Madhya Pradesh
content: A purported CCTV footage of the incident has appeared on social media showing a police constable hitting a youth with baton

title: ED nabs Assistant Drug Controller in Himachal for corruption, cheating, forgery
content: ED initiated investigation on the basis of FIR registered by State Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau

title: CBI registers case against five suspended Tihar Jail officials and three inmates on bribery and extortion charges
content: The Delhi High Court took note of the charges and ordered an inquiry by the Inspecting Judge of Tihar Jail

title: Unemployment is still a core issue in Bihar
content: Bihar needs a strategy to revive education, create formal jobs and stem the outmigration of its workforce

title: For three years, Madras University had no money to print marksheets
content: Varsity has been in doldrums owing to drastic cuts in its budget and stoppage of State grants following audit objections; it got a breather last month, after govt. allotted ₹17.84 crore with which it is making essential purchases and clearing backlogs

title: Key accused in spurious liquor racket in A.P. picked up at Gannavaram airport
content: Addepalli Janardhana Rao is facing the charge of manufacturing spurious liquor at Mukalacheruvu in Annamayya district

title: BJP casting its net wide looking for new slaves, says Udhayanidhi Stalin
content: Criticising AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami and Governor R.N. Ravi, he says Tamil Nadu will yet again prove it is a land of self-respect in the 2026 Assembly election

title: Taliban will not allow terrorists to use Afghan territory, says Muttaqi
content: Taliban Foreign Minister rules out joint operation with India against terrorists, and pitches for bigger trade ties with India through the Wagah border; he terms criticism of Taliban on gender rights “international propaganda”

title: Centre approves ₹166 crore for expansion of AYUSH services in State: Health Minister
content: Funds will be used to set up Ayurveda and Unani colleges, 50-bed integrated AYUSH hospitals, and a Yoga Research Centre across the State, he says

title: Congress alleges delegation stopped from visiting Rae Bareli lynching victim’s family
content: Congress condemns authoritarian actions of local administration, vows to support the family of a Dalit man lynched in Rae Bareli

title: Sea phase of KONKAN 25 ends with high operational tempo
content: The exercise maintained a high operational tempo, reflecting the robust capabilities and preparedness of both navies in complex, multi-domain warfare scenarios

title: India-China ties are now defined by competitive coexistence: ex-diplomat Nirupama Menon Rao
content: The former Foreign Secretary was delivering the opening remarks at a panel discussion on a book released by The Hindu Group, titled, China: Indian Perspectives on China’s Politics, Economy, and Foreign Relations.

title: There is a difference between refugees and infiltrators: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said according to the 2011 Census in Assam, the decadal growth of the Muslim population in the State was 29%, which is not possible without infiltration; in West Bengal, the decadal growth of Muslim population has crossed 40% and in some districts it is 70%”

title: Won’t spare anyone if something untoward happens to Ramadoss: Anbumani
content: He criticises his father’s supporters for turning Dr. Ramadoss into an ‘exhibit’ after he underwent a routine angiogram procedure in Chennai recently

title: 6 State-level RTI panels are defunct; appeals can take years to be heard: report
content: The Satark Nagrik Sangathan’s annual report shows that Information Commissions — which hear appeals against RTI responses by government bodies — may take years to even hear a case

title: Menstrual leave: Many women welcome move, unorganised workers too seek inclusion
content: A union leader pointed out that while many employers argue that menstrual leave will discourage hiring women, similar arguments were raised globally against maternity leave at one point in time

title: 2 Indians face U.S. sanctions for aiding Iran with oil trade
content: They own vessels that transported Iranian LPG to Pakistan and China, as per the U.S., which has imposed sanctions on 50 entities, individuals and vessels

title: Hydropower project on Chenab gets clearance
content: The Sawalkote project was first accorded an environmental clearance in 2017; the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty with Pakistan added momentum to the approval process, says official

title: Army chiefs of 33 nations to meet in Delhi on peace operations
content: 5,500 Indian men and women are deployed across nine countries as part of UN peacekeeping missions; India has also made the highest sacrifice among peacekeeping nations

title: Armstrong murder case: Supreme Court stays Madras High Court order quashing chargesheet
content: Advocates for the police argue that the chargesheet was quashed based on a cursory reading of vague allegations by Armstrong’s brother

title: Bengaluru Development Authority powers will be transferred to GBA: DKS
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar did not mention anything regarding the fund allocation for the corporations during the meeting and said all infrastructure projects will be done under GBA, and funds will be allocated accordingly.

title: Bodies of two missing soldiers traced in upper reaches of south Kashmir
content: The two had gone missing during an anti-terror operation; Army rules out terror angle after soldiers’ bodies and service rifles were recovered

title: 4-day training for first phase of Census 2027 pre-test starts in Delhi
content: Registrar General and Census Commissioner highlights the pivotal role of Lead Trainers in the smooth conduct of the first-ever Digital Census in the country

title: Centre issues guidelines for retiring government employees
content: The guidelines have been issued for effective inter-ministerial coordination for timely payment of retirement dues and the appointment of a welfare officer for each retiring employee

title: Guide wire retrieval: Medical College cardiologists examine woman
content: Two weeks ago, a medical board constituted in the issue had said that attempts to retrieve the guide wire which has become fused with the vein could be dangerous

title: Leaders from JD(U), LJP(RV) join RJD ahead of elections
content: A former JD(U) MP, a former MLA, and the son of a sitting MP switch over, along with a former candidate of the Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas)

title: National Conference names candidates for J&K Rajya Sabha polls, drops Farooq Abdullah for ‘health reasons’
content: Mr. Abdullah, elected to the Lok Sabha for the first time in 1980 at 43, has been the party’s longest-serving parliamentarian in both the Houses from 2002 to 2014

title: Southern Discom to upgrade transformers in areas with high load growth soon
content: Several substations, lines in and around Hyderabad to have 16 MVA PTRs, 1,000 kVA DTRs to bear higher loads

title: Cough syrup deaths: Tamil Nadu’s Sresan Pharma owner brought to M.P.’s Chhindwara, sent to 10-day police custody
content: Police interrogate owner on manufacturing processes, personnel involved in manufacturing, quality checks; “highly unusual” that 46% toxic substances could be added by mistake or negligence, say police

title: Maharashtra government announces draft rules for app-based aggregators of public transport vehicles
content: These rules are applicable to the app-based public transport services, including e-rickshaws, Ola, Uber, Rapido, and others, aiming for discipline, transparency and passenger safety in services

title: 2,200 schools do not have permanent physical education teachers: Minister
content: Only 281 permanent physical education teachers work in upper primary schools and 1,508 in high schools

title: Human-wildlife conflict mitigation measures reviewed
content: Authorities to identify specific wildlife species and the regions most prone to human-wildlife conflict

title: SC seeks Centre, EC response on plea challenging voting bar on undertrials
content: Petition urges court to reconsider ‘blanket disqualification’ of prisoners from voting, calls for limited and individualised restrictions

title: Kozhikode cyber police nab key suspect in alleged ₹1.2 crore financial fraud
content: The suspect was detained after police analysed and collected digital evidence related to the fund transfers against him

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu lauds ‘Save The Bull’ initiative
content: An innovative initiative of the Chinta Sasidhar Foundation, a bull-powered treadmill system generates 4 KW when a single bull walks on it for four hours a day

title: A.P. Women’s Commission to launch online portal for swift redressal of women’s grievances
content: Chairperson Rayapati Sailaja announces new initiative, emphasises continuous awareness and strict action against harassment and social media abuse

title: Pallium India appeals to WHO for special palliative care strategy for Global South
content: On the occasion of the World Hospice and Palliative Care Day on October 11, low and middle income countries, including India, are nowhere near the goal of Universal Health Coverage, including palliative care, set for 2030

title: NorthEast United FC keeps a seat empty as tribute to Zubeen at India-Singapore tie
content: The Highlander Brigade, as the club is popularly known, recalled how Garg had said that football was his first love

title: Planners and architects will play key role in achieving ‘Viksit Bharat’, says IIT Tirupati Director
content: At SPA Vijayawada’s ninth convocation, K.N. Satyanarayana highlights sustainability, technology, heritage, and human-centric design as the four drivers of India’s future cities, while emphasizing closer collaboration with IIT Tirupati and the role of graduates in building inclusive, innovative urban spaces

title: Aces finish off Mercury for 3rd title in 4 years
content: The Aces beat the Mercury 97-86 on Friday night to complete a four-game Finals sweep and win their third WNBA championship in four seasons.

title: Source: Pujols, Angels discuss managerial opening
content: Albert Pujols met with Angels general manager Perry Minasian about the team's managerial vacancy Thursday night but hasn't been offered the job, a source told ESPN.

title: Sources: Big Ten closes in on $2 billion capital deal
content: The Big Ten is approaching a vote on a capital agreement and the formation of Big Ten Enterprises, which would infuse league schools with more than $2 billion, according to sources.

title: Knicks, Raptors agree to voluntarily dismiss lawsuit
content: The Knicks and Raptors agreed to voluntarily dismiss a 2023 lawsuit involving the alleged theft of thousands of confidential files, according to a court filing Friday that was obtained by ESPN.

title: 49ers set to start QB Jones again; Pearsall out
content: Mac Jones is slated to start in place of the injured Brock Purdy on Sunday against the Bucs, while receiver Ricky Pearsall will miss his second straight game.

title: Lamar ruled out; Ravens to roll with Rush again
content: The Ravens have ruled quarterback Lamar Jackson out for Sunday's game against the Rams, marking the second straight week he has missed.

title: Balogun strikes as USMNT rallies for Ecuador draw
content: The United States battled back for a 1-1 draw with Ecuador after Folarin Balogun scored in the second half of a back-and-forth match at Q2 Stadium in Austin, Texas, on Friday night.

title: Messi sits out Argentina victory in Miami friendly
content: The Argentina national team, playing without Lionel Messi, beat Venezuela 1-0 on Friday in a friendly at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami, Florida.

title: 🍼 Bo Nix and wife Izzy announce pregnancy
content: The Denver Broncos quarterback announced the news in a shared Instagram post with his wife, Izzy Nix.

title: 'You run out of adjectives': Another year, another title for A'ja Wilson
content: Wilson has been called a lot of things this postseason: an elk, a shark, a lion. But is it time to call her the GOAT?

title: 31 games that could bring a sense of order to college football's season of chaos
content: New attractions -- Indiana-Oregon and Alabama-Missouri -- mix with old standbys such as Oklahoma-Texas this weekend.

title: WWE Crown Jewel preview: Rollins-Rhodes, Cena tour stop, more
content: As WWE Crown Jewel heads to Perth, Western Australia, we break down the biggest storylines, including John Cena's retirement tour.

title: Pain, rehab and unlikely inspiration: Inside Aidan Hutchinson's return to dominance
content: Hutchinson's long journey back from a broken leg found inspiration from children whom he has inspired, too.

title: QB musical chairs? Why the AFC North is struggling at the premier position
content: Aaron Rodgers is the only starting QB in the division who began 2025 in that capacity for the same team.

title: The greatest Yankee never to win a World Series? Another Aaron Judge year wasted -- so what's next?
content: It was another October exit, and the Yankees captain turns 34 in April. Here's what we know -- and don't know -- about next year in the Bronx.

title: Offseason questions for eliminated teams: What's next for Yankees
content: Here's how the winter looks in New York -- and in the other towns whose teams lost in the postseason.

title: Four ways LeBron James' unprecedented 23rd NBA season could go
content: Retirement? Re-up with the Lakers? Request a trade? Here are the various pathways for LeBron and the Lakers for the 2025-26 campaign.

title: Don't be surprised if... McMillan finds end zone, Judkins finishes top 3 in rushing
content: Week 6 storylines include a pair of impressive rookies, and is the Mayfield/Egbuka connection sustainable?

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 6
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks, plus projected scores for every game.

title: How to fix Man United in four steps (with some help from Liverpool, Arsenal and Man City)
content: Man United haven't had sustained Premier League success in more than a decade. Here's what they need to do, by following the playbooks of Liverpool, Arsenal and Man City.

title: How Oregon's Dante Moore, Indiana's Fernando Mendoza became unlikely NFL darlings
content: An under-the-radar three-star and a seemingly forgotten five-star, Mendoza and Moore are rising up draft boards.

title: Reid's debut NFL draft QB Hot Board for 2026
content: Who are the best quarterbacks in class? We ranked the top 14, including some playing each other this week.

title: NHL breakout tiers: From Nazar to Snuggerud to Peterka, players set to level up
content: From players with new linemates to young stars set to hit superstardom to enticing rookies, watch out for this group.

title: Wetzel: Why college basketball coaches can watch more football in 2025
content: The NCAA's stalled 5-in-5 rule has put a hold on much of college basketball recruiting until next spring.

title: Why did CFB move its transfer portal? What do coaches think? Is tampering a problem?
content: The NCAA officially moved its football transfer portal to January, but not without questions. We have answers.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Mateusz Gamrot end Charles Oliveira unbeaten streak in Brazil?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the UFC Fight Night Rio main event, and Ian Parker gives value picks for the card.

title: 75 stadiums, 45 states, one vision: Why the Savannah Bananas' next step is their biggest yet
content: The Savannah Bananas prepare for a new era of bodacious baseball. Check out what "Banana Ball" is doing next.

title: 'You're just poking the bear': Bucs' Wirfs recalls fan heckling Baker in Seattle
content: Buccaneers left tackle Tristan Wirfs witnessed Baker Mayfield's trash-talking exchange with a Seattle Seahawks fan last Sunday.

title: Angel Reese to become first professional athlete in Victoria's Secret Fashion Show
content: The Chicago Sky star will make history as the first professional athlete to walk in the fashion show.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Milan eye possible Tonali return
content: Newcastle United midfielder Sandro Tonali has been linked to numerous clubs across Europe, including his previous club AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: College football best bets for Week 7: Why an 0-5 team should be on your bet slip
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 7 of the college football season, including what makes UMass-Kent State a solid game to bet.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Packers, Broncos among top options in Week 6
content: Predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 6, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Cheat sheet: 2025-26 NBA player rankings, schedule grid, more
content: Here is all of our key fantasy basketball draft content -- rankings, sleepers, schedule grid and draft tips -- collected into downloadable/printable PDF cheat sheets.

title: Melania Trump Says Putin Talks Secured Return Of Ukraine War Children
content: US First Lady Melania Trump said Friday she had secured the release of Ukrainian children abducted by Russia after establishing an extraordinary back channel of communication with President Vladimir Putin.

title: Macron Reappoints Sebastien Lecornu As France's PM 4 Days After He Quit
content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday reappointed his outgoing prime minister, Sebastien Lecornu, back into that position, just four days after Lecornu gave his resignation.

title: Putin Says "No Big Deal" If US Declines To Extend Nuclear Warhead Limits
content: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russia was developing new strategic weapons and it would not be critical for Moscow if the United States declined to extend the warhead limits set out in a nuclear arms treaty that expires next year.

title: Court Orders CID Probe Into Alleged Custodial Death Of Man In Tamil Nadu
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court today ordered a probe by the Crime Branch-CID (CBCID) into the alleged custodial death of a 30-year-old man, Dinesh Kumar, in Madurai.

title: "I Saved Millions Of Lives": Trump Reacts To Not Winning Nobel Peace Prize
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday reacted to not winning the Nobel Peace Prize this year, claiming that he had extended assistance to the awardee, Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, on multiple occasions.

title: North Korea Holds Military Parade To Celebrate Ruling Party's 80th Anniversary
content: North Korea has held a military parade marking the 80th anniversary of its ruling Workers' Party, with high-level foreign guests in attendance, state media said Saturday.

title: Coldrif Cough Syrup Deaths: Pharma Firm Owner Sent To 10-Day Police Custody
content: A Parasia court on Friday sent Sresan Pharma owner Ranganathan to 10-day police custody in connection with the deaths of children allegedly caused by the consumption of Coldrif cough syrup.

title: Akasa Flight Suffers Bird Hit, Makes Emergency Landing In Delhi
content: An Akasa Air aircraft flying from Pune to Delhi suffered a bird hit on Friday and landed safely in the national capital.

title: Multiple Dead, 19 Missing After Massive Blast At US Explosives Factory
content: An explosion at a Tennessee military munitions plant Friday left 19 people missing and feared dead, authorities said.

title: Trump Says He Believes Gaza Ceasefire Will "Hold"
content: US President Donald Trump said he believed the Israeli ceasefire that began in Gaza on Friday would hold as Israel and Hamas are "tired" of fighting.

title: Trump Slaps 100% Tariff On China, Threatens To Scrap Talks With Xi Jinping
content: US President Donald Trump announced an additional 100 percent tariff on China Friday and threatened to cancel a summit with Xi Jinping, reigniting his trade war with Beijing in a row over export curbs on rare earth minerals.

title: US Slams Nobel Committee For Ignoring Trump's Global Peace Efforts
content: The White House on Friday slammed the Nobel Peace Prize Committee, accusing it of ignoring President Donald Trump's contributions to global peace, an honour he has been aggressively seeking often on the back of exaggerated or unverified claims.

title: "Separate Administration From Manipur Not Our Stand": Meghalaya Chief Minister
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma on Friday said his party NPP is against separate administration for the Kuki tribes and bifurcation of Manipur.

title: Qualcomm Chief To NDTV On Company's Plans In India, AI And 6G
content: Qualcomm President Cristiano R Amon in an interview with NDTV's Vishnu Som said 6G is the connectivity for the age of AI (artificial intelligence).

title: Several Dead, Missing After Blast At Explosives Plant In Tennessee
content: Multiple people were dead or missing after a massive blast rocked a US military explosives plant Friday, officials said, sending emergency responders rushing to the site and prompting warnings for the public to avoid the area.

title: MIT Rejects Bid To Adopt Trump's Agenda For Funding Benefits
content: The president of the MIT said Friday she "cannot support" a White House proposal that asks MIT and eight other universities to adopt President Donald Trump's political agenda in exchange for favorable access to federal funding.

title: Got A Fix For Delhi's Air? Win Rs 50 Lakh In New Clean-Air Innovation Challenge
content: The Delhi government on Friday launched a first-of-its-kind Innovation Challenge to crowdsource affordable technologies that can directly cut particulate pollution from roads, vehicles, and construction sites.

title: 'Miyas' Will Be Largest Community In Assam In Next Census: Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday claimed that 'Miya-Muslims' (Bengali-speaking Muslims) will emerge as the largest community in the state in the next census.

title: Akhilesh Yadav's Facebook Account Suspended, Claims Party, Hits Out At BJP
content: The Samajwadi Party has launched an attack on the BJP after party chief Akhilesh Yadav's Facebook page remained inaccessible, calling it an attempt to suppress opposition voices.

title: Delhi's Big Eco-Tourism Push With Nature Walks And 'Purple Bus' Tours
content: The Delhi government is preparing to launch a series of eco-tourism initiatives- from weekly nature walks and wildlife awareness drives to a new "Purple Bus" circuit connecting popular and lesser-known heritage sites in the national capital.

title: Woman, her husband, father & brother get life term for killing her lover
content: Krishna Chaudhary, a mass communication graduate, is a Senior Correspondent covering the sugar belt of Western Uttar Pradesh. He loves reporting on crime, politics, and impactful human-interest stories. Read More

title: Haryana cop suicide: Wife Amneet Kumar expresses dissatisfaction with FIR
content: Ajay Sura is Senior Assistant Editor with The Times of India Chandigarh. He covers news concerning the State of Haryana, Punjab & Haryana High Court and Defence & Military Affairs. He likes to analyse political developments and decoding judicial pronouncements. His hobbies include travelling, mountaineering and trekking. Read More

title: Congress sponsored Nagpur OBC march, says Manoj Jarange
content:
Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange

CHHTATRAPATI SAMBHAJINAGAR: Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange on Friday said the recent mega OBC march in Nagpur was a Congress and Rahul Gandhi-sponsored event, aimed more at political gains than genuine community welfare, reports Mohammed Akhef. He also criticised key OBC netas and NCP chief Sharad Pawar. The march was organised to oppose Maharashtra government's September 2 goverment resolution (GR) on reservations. "This is not an OBC march. It is a Congress rally organised for political gains. It seems the parties in office and the opposition are conspiring against our reservation," Jarange said. Warning the state goverment against withdrawing reservation, Jarange said, "If the goverment is considering this, we will not spare it. Why are they suddenly feeling their share in reservation is getting reduced because of the inclusion of Marathas? Why did they not react when many other castes were included in OBC?"

End of Article

content: the protesters were demanding the immediate suspension of faculty members on Karaikal and Puducherry campuses accused of sexually harassing research scholars and students . the students were also demanding the reconstitution of an internal complaints committee (ICC) in accordance with UGC’s sexual harassment of women employees and students in higher educational institutions regulations .

title: Enforcement Directorate names senior advocate accused in Religare laundering case
content: ED was forced to withdraw summons to senior advocate Pratap Venugopal . he was named as one of the accused, along with former chairperson Rashmi Saluja . the chargesheet was filed in the case before a special court in Mumbai .

title: Police brutality: Two on-duty cops beat DSP’s relative to death in city
content: Udit Gayaki, 21, was celebrating with friends when the constables reportedly assaulted him and demanded money . he complained of uneasiness and was declared dead at AIIMS Bhopal . the youth, brother-in-law of a DSP, died in the early hours of Friday .
